definition: doubly homesick for our dear ones at each festive day (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: mei3 feng2 jia1 jie2 bei4 si1 qin1

definition: each/every
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
beautiful/fine/good
surname Jia

sentences.english: People always become extremely homesick when festivals come, especially on Mid-Autumn Festival, the most traditional one.
sentences.chinese: 每逢佳節倍思親，特別是中秋節，最傳統的節日。

sentences.english: On festive occasions more than ever we think of our dear ones faraway, said Ambassador Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 張大使說，每逢佳節倍思親。

definition: (literary) (of a married woman) to visit one's parents
to drink and chat merrily (idiom)
lit. not to know the true face of Lushan Mountain/fig. can't see the forest for the trees
pinyin: bu4 shi4 Lu2 shan1 zhen1 mian4 mu4

definition: at one's ease/carefree
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
lit. the duck is the first to know if the spring water is warm (idiom)/fig. an expert in the field knows which way the wind blows
